page.title: 02MARKLAND FARM CLOWNE
page.content: MR.NICHOLSON RENTS THE FARM FROM CHATSWORTH ESTATES.THREE PEOPLE HELP MR.NICHOLSON TO RUN THE FARM WHICH COVERS 80 HECTARES OF LAND. THE CROPS MR.NICHOLSON GROWS BARLEY AND GRASS.HE USES THE GRAIN FROM THE BARLEY TO FEED TO THE CATTLE.IF THERE IS ANY LEFT,HE SELLS IT.HE USES THE STRAW FOR BEDDING DOWN THE CATTLE. THE GRASS(LEY) HE CUTS ONCE IN MAY AND AGAIN IN JULY FOR SILAGE.THE SILAGE IS USED TO FEED TO THE COWS IN WINTER.CATTLE GRAZE ON THE LEY PASTURE AFTER THE SECOND CUT. THE PERMANENT GRASS HE ALSO GROWS IS USED FOR CATTLE GRAZING. HE ALSO GROWS STUBBLE TURNIPS,ON WHICH THE CATTLE GRAZE IN AUTUMN.
